intro: Neogaillonia incana, commonly known as the silky neogallworts, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its soft, silvery-hairy foliage, which gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are clustered in complex inflorescences called cyathia. Neogaillonia incana is native to parts of Asia and is often found in temperate regions with high humidity.
